    boolean
    handleHit(Direction dir, int k)
    if the ship is hit destroy the target tile
    IMPORTANT!!! this methode does not check if the player can use batteries to defend the ship or if the hit causes the tile to break therefore it should only be called after checkHit if and only if a tile would actually be broken

  • Method Details

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Returns:
      level of the ship

    • getColor

      public PlayerColor getColor()
      Returns:
      the PlayerColor representing the ship's color

    • getTilesMatrix

      public Tile[][] getTilesMatrix()
      Retrieves the two-dimensional array representing the matrix of tiles.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of Tile objects representing the tile matrix.

    • getValidSlots

      public boolean[][] getValidSlots()
      Returns:
      a 2D boolean array representing valid slots where tiles can be placed

    • isSlotValid

      public boolean isSlotValid(int x, int y)
      Checks if the given slot coordinates are valid within the defined boundaries and if the slot is marked as valid in the validSlots array.
      Parameters:
      x - the row index of the slot to be checked
      y - the column index of the slot to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the slot coordinates are within bounds and the slot is valid, otherwise false

    • getNumBrokenTiles

      public int getNumBrokenTiles()
      Returns:
      the count of broken tiles as an integer.

    • getShipWidth

      public int getShipWidth()
      Returns:
      the width of the ship as an integer

    • getShipHeight

      public int getShipHeight()
      Returns:
      the height of the ship as an integer.

    • getTilesMap

      public Map<String,List<Coordinates>> getTilesMap()
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are tile names as strings, and the values are lists of Coordinates objects.

    • isOutOfBounds

      public boolean isOutOfBounds(int x, int y)
      checks if the indexes are inside the matrix
      Parameters:
      x - row
      y - column
      Returns:
      true if indexes out of bounds false if inbound

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int x, int y)
      returns Tile in slot x, y and null if no tile is found in (x,y)
      Parameters:
      x - row
      y - column
      Returns:
      the Tile in position x, y if present, null otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the indexes are not valid

    • placeTile

      public boolean placeTile(Tile tile, int x, int y)
      places a tile in a specific slot and calls tile.place(...) which takes care of updating ship and tile attributes lastly it updates exposedConnectors
      Parameters:
      tile - tile to place
      x - row
      y - column
      Returns:
      true if the slot x, y is valid and empty and the tile is not null,
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the x, y indexes are out of bounds false if slot is invalid or already taken or the selected tile is null

    • isPlacingLegal

      public boolean isPlacingLegal(Tile tile, int x, int y)
      Determines if placing a tile at the specified coordinates on the grid is legal.
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile to be placed; must not be null
      x - the x-coordinate of the position where the tile is to be placed
      y - the y-coordinate of the position where the tile is to be placed
      Returns:
      true if the placement is legal, according to the game rules; false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified coordinates are out of bounds

    • breakAllTiles

      public void breakAllTiles()
      breaks all the tiles of the ship, done to simplify testing

    • updateNumBrokenTiles

      public void updateNumBrokenTiles(int numBrokenTiles)
      Updates the number of broken tiles by subtracting the specified value.
      Parameters:
      numBrokenTiles - the number of tiles to subtract from the current count of broken tiles

    • breakTile

      public void breakTile(int x, int y)
      removes the tile in the x, y slot and calls tile.broken(...) which takes care of updating ship and tile attributes lastly it updates exposedConnectors
      Parameters:
      x - row
      y - column
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the slot is not valid or if there is not a tile in the slot

    • getTilesBuffer

      public List<Tile> getTilesBuffer()
      Returns:
      a list of Tile objects representing the buffer

      Parameters:
      tile - the tile object to be added to the buffer

    • getNumCrew

      public int getNumCrew()
      Retrieves the total number of crew members by summing up the counts of specific crew types: PINK_ALIEN, BROWN_ALIEN, and HUMAN.
      Returns:
      the total number of crew members.

    • getBoxes

      public Map<BoxType,Integer> getBoxes()
      Retrieves a map representing the types of boxes and their corresponding quantities.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are of type BoxType representing the type of box, and the values are integers representing the quantity of each box type.

    • getBoxes

      public int getBoxes(BoxType type)
      Retrieves the number of boxes for the specified box type.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of box whose count is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the number of boxes of the specified type

      public void removeBatteries(int usedBatteries, int x, int y)
      removes int lostBatteries from ship attribute numBatteries and from tile attribute numBatteries
      Parameters:
      usedBatteries - number of batteries to remove
      x - row
      y - column

      public void addBatteries(int newBatteries)
      adds int newBatteries to ship attribute numBatteries
      Parameters:
      newBatteries - number of batteries to add

    • removeBox

      public void removeBox(BoxType boxType, int x, int y)
      removes a single box of type boxType from ship attribute boxes and from tile attribute boxes
      Parameters:
      boxType - type of the box to remove
      x - row
      y - column
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are no boxes to be removed from ship.boxes

    • addBox

      public void addBox(BoxType boxType, int x, int y)
      adds a single box of type boxType to ship attribute boxes and to tile attribute boxes
      Parameters:
      boxType - type of the box to add
      x - row
      y - column

    • setBoxes

      public void setBoxes(Map<BoxType,Integer> newBoxes, int x, int y)
      updates ship.boxes and tile.boxes of the tile at position x, y to new configuration in the specific tile in position x, y
      Parameters:
      newBoxes - map of the new StorageTile configuration
      x - row
      y - columns
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the selected tile is not a StorageTile

    • removeBestBoxes

      public void removeBestBoxes(int lostBoxes)
      this methode removes int lostBoxes boxes from ship prioritizing high value boxes if the ship has not enough boxes batteries are removed
      Parameters:
      lostBoxes - number of boxes/batteries to remove

    • removeCrewByType

      public void removeCrewByType(CrewType type)
      removes a single crewMember of type type from this.crewMap
      Parameters:
      type - type of crewMember to remove

    • removeCrew

      public void removeCrew(CrewType type, int x, int y, int num)
      removes num crewMembers of type type from the HousingTile at position x, y and from this.crewMap
      Parameters:
      type - type of crewMembers to be removed
      x - row
      y - column
      num - number of crewMembers to be removed
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there are not enough members to be removed in this.crewMap

    • addCrew

      public void addCrew(CrewType type, int x, int y)
      fills the HousingTile in position x, y with crewMember/s of type type and adds them to this.crewMap if the type is HUMAN adds 2, otherwise adds 1
      Parameters:
      type - type of crewMember to be added
      x - row
      y - column
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the argument type is not support by the specific HousingTile

    • getNumExposedConnectors

      public int getNumExposedConnectors()
      Returns:
      the number of exposed connectors as an integer.

    • getProtectedDirections

      public List<Direction> getProtectedDirections()
      Returns:
      a list of Direction objects representing the protected directions.

    • getBaseFirePower

      public double getBaseFirePower()
      Returns:
      the base firepower as a double value.

    • getBasePropulsionPower

      public int getBasePropulsionPower()
      Returns:
      the base propulsion power as an integer

    • updateBaseFirePower

      public void updateBaseFirePower(double i)
      Updates the base firepower of the entity by adding the given value to the current base firepower.
      Parameters:
      i - the value to be added to the current base firepower

    • updateBasePropulsionPower

      public void updateBasePropulsionPower(int i)
      Updates the base propulsion power by adding the specified increment value.
      Parameters:
      i - the value to be added to the current base propulsion power

    • updateExposedConnectors

      public void updateExposedConnectors()
      updates this.numExposedConnectors it's called after each placeTile and BreakTile

    • removeProtectedDirections

      public void removeProtectedDirections(Set<Direction> dir)
      remove all the directions contained in dir from the list this.protectedDirections
      Parameters:
      dir - set of direction to be removed from protectedDirections list

    • addProtectedDirections

      public void addProtectedDirections(Set<Direction> dir)
      adds all the directions contained in dir to the list this.protectedDirections
      Parameters:
      dir - set of direction to be added to protectedDirections list

    • isShipLegal

      public boolean isShipLegal()
      Returns:
      true if the ship is legal and connected, false otherwise

    • isShipConnectedBFS

      public boolean isShipConnectedBFS()
      Returns:
      true if the ship is connected
      false otherwise

    • checkHit

      public int checkHit(Direction dir, Attack attack, int k, String attackType)
      calls checkMeteor or checkAttack depending on attackType argument
      Parameters:
      dir - direction of attack
      attack - LIGHT or HEAVY
      k - dices result (shifted to match matrix indexing)
      attackType - meteor or shot, case-insensitive
      Returns:
      see return values of checkMeteor and checkAttack

    • checkShot

      public int checkShot(Direction dir, Attack attack, int k)
      this methode checks if the ship is hit by an attack and if the player can defend the ship through shields
      Parameters:
      dir - attack direction
      attack - HEAVY or LIGHT
      k - dices result (shifted to match matrix indexing)
      Returns:
      -1 if the attack does not hit the ship
      0 if player can defend the ship with a shield
      2 if the ship is hit and the player can not do anything about it

    • checkMeteor

      public int checkMeteor(Direction dir, Attack meteor, int k)
      this methode checks if the ship is hit by a meteorite and if the player can use cannons or shields to defend teh ship
      Parameters:
      dir - attack direction
      meteor - HEAVY or LIGHT
      k - dices result (shifted to match matrix indexing)
      Returns:
      -2 if the attacked in neutralized by a single cannon
      -1 if the attack does not hit the ship
      0 if player can defend the ship with a shield
      1 if the player can defend the ship with a double cannon
      2 if the ship is hit and the player can not do anything about it

    • handleHit

      public boolean handleHit(Direction dir, int k)
      if the ship is hit destroy the target tile
      IMPORTANT!!! this methode does not check if the player can use batteries to defend the ship or if the hit causes the tile to break therefore it should only be called after checkHit if and only if a tile would actually be broken
      Parameters:
      dir - direction of the attack
      k - dices result (shifted to match matrix indexing)
      Returns:
      true if hit
      false if not hit

    • hasEnoughHumans

      public boolean hasEnoughHumans()
      Checks if the crew has enough human members.
      Returns:
      true if the number of human crew members is greater than 0, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • draw

      public String draw()
      Generates a string representation of a ship layout. The layout depicts a grid of tiles where each tile may contain a specific drawable object or represent an empty area. Each tile's content is displayed as a rectangular block of characters.
      Returns:
      A formatted string representation of the ship's layout grid, including all tiles and row/column indices.

    • drawWithBuffer

      public String drawWithBuffer()
      Generates a string representation of a ship layout with the buffer. The layout depicts a grid of tiles where each tile may contain a specific drawable object or represent an empty area. Each tile's content is displayed as a rectangular block of characters.
      Returns:
      A formatted string representation of the ship's layout grid, including all tiles and row/column indices.
